page.title: 08MICROCLIMATE: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: The{Warley Ridge}and the presence of {woodlands}results in noticeable variations in the local climate. It invariably feels cooler on the top of the Ridge because of the breezes which cause higher rates of evaporation from the skin. In terms of actual temperature, however, there are measureable differences, particularly on south-facing{slopes.}Measurements were carried out in Great Warley in June at various times of day, and it was found that shade temperatures varied by as much as 2.4 C on north- facing slopes and 4.3 C on south- facing slopes, within an altitudinal range of 30 metres. Temperature difference of up to 4 C were recorded between the interior and exterior of {woods.}More commonly, however, the differences were about 1 C.
